title: I know there is software to combine an SSD and an HHD and treat them as a single drive. The OS and programs are loaded to the SSD on an as-needed basis. What is the name of that software? - Quora

response.answer_text: When its sold as a single drive it’s typically called a “hybrid drive”, Hybrid Hard Drives Explained: Why You Might Want One Instead of an SSD It basically does what you suggested but at the hardware level. So you can have a 5 TB spinning disk with 256 GB SSD. I don’t think there are any software offerings to do what you’re suggesting though. You could do it manually by just installing your applications on the HD but using the SSD for frequently accessed files.

It’s called an “HSM” or “Hierarchical Storage Manager”. Generally they are not as transparent as you appear to hope, unless you are paying a very lot of money for them. Typically, you’d buy them from a company such as Veritas, or a similar company, which specializes in such software. For the most part, the OS doesn’t know it’s happening.
